headline.print_headline: Tobacco Companies Are Told to Correct Lies About Smoking
headline.main: Tobacco Companies Are Told to Correct Lies About Smoking

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Gladys Kessler rules that tobacco companies must publish corrective statements admitting they lied years ago about the dangers of smoking; previously said she wanted the industry to pay for corrective statements, but ruling is first time she laid out what the statements will say.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Washington ruled that the companies must publish statements admitting they lied years ago about the dangers of smoking.
docs.snippet: A federal judge in Washington ruled that the companies must publish statements admitting they lied years ago about the dangers of smoking.

headline.print_headline: Hazards: Airport Smoking Areas Affect Nearby Sites
headline.main: Airport Smoking Areas Affect Nearby Sites

docs.abstract: According to a study from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, airports with smoking areas all have unhealthy air - even in places where no one smokes.
docs.snippet: According to a study from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, airports with smoking areas all have unhealthy air - even in places where no one smokes.
